reactor.tcp

Interface Reconnect


  • public interface Reconnect
    Implementations of this interface will be instantiated by a Supplier to provide information to the TcpClient whether or not to attempt to reconnect a broken connection.

    The reconnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress, int) method will be invoked, passing the currently-connected address and the number of times a reconnection has been attempted on this connection. If the client is to reconnect to a different host, then provide that different address in the return value. If you don't want to try and reconnect at all, simply return null.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      reactor.tuple.Tuple2<java.net.InetSocketAddress,java.lang.Long> reconnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress currentAddress, int attempt)
      Provide an InetSocketAddress to which a reconnection attempt should be made.

    • Method Detail

      • reconnect

        reactor.tuple.Tuple2<java.net.InetSocketAddress,java.lang.Long> reconnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress currentAddress,
                                                                        int attempt)
        Provide an InetSocketAddress to which a reconnection attempt should be made.
        Parameters:
        currentAddress - the address to which the client is currently connected
        Returns:
        a possibly different InetSocketAddress to which a reconnection attempt should be made and a Long denoting the time to delay a reconnection attempt
